intro: Lethedon calleana, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette, while its flowers are usually pale green or white with a distinctive lip. Due to its habitat specificity, Lethedon calleana is considered a rare and endangered species.
